analyzed: yaḥ puna bhikṣuḥ anya atikāye bhikṣuṇīye purāṇa cīvaram dhovāpeya vā rañjāpeya vā ākoṭāpeya vā nissargika pācattikam  yaḥ puna bhikṣuḥ anyātakam gṛhapatim vā gṛhapati putram
translated: If a monk has a robe washed, dyed, or beaten by a nun from another religious community, he commits a pācattika offense.

original: Śtipatinīṃ vā cīvaraṃ yāceya anyatra samaye nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: vā cīvaram yāceya anyatra samaye nissargika pācattikam
translated: If a monk asks a householder or a householder’s son or a householder’s daughter for a robe, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits a pācattika offense.

original: tatrāyaṃ samayo ācchinnacīvaro bhikṣur bhavati /
analyzed: tatra ayam samayaḥ ācchinna cīvaraḥ bhikṣuḥ bhavati
translated: In this case, an appropriate occasion is when a monk’s robe has been stolen.

original: ayam atra samayo /
analyzed: ayam atra samayaḥ
translated: This is the appropriate occasion.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / ācchinnacīvareṇa bhikṣuṇā kṣamate anyātakaṃ gṛhapatiṃ vā gṛhapatiputrīṃ Śtipatinīṃ vā cīvaraṃ yācituṃ /
analyzed: ācchinna cīvareṇa bhikṣuṇā kṣamate anyātakam gṛhapatim vā gṛhapati putrīm śti patinīm vā cīvaram yācitum
translated: If a monk’s robe has been stolen, he may ask a householder or a householder’s son or a householder’s daughter for a robe.

original: tam enam abhihṛṣṭo samāno saṃbahulehi cīvarehi pravāreya /
analyzed: tam enam abhihṛṣṭaḥ samānaḥ saṃbahulehi cīvarehi pravāreya
translated: If he is pleased, he should offer many robes.

original: tathāpravāritena bhikṣuṇā sāntarottaraparamaṃ cīvaraṃ sādayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: tathā pravāritena bhikṣuṇā sa antara uttara paramam cīvaram sādayitavyam
translated: If a monk is offered robes in this way, he should accept at most one inner robe and one outer robe.

original: taduttariṃ sādiyeya nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: tad uttarim sādiyeya nissargika pācattikam
translated: If he accepts more than that, he commits a pācattika offense.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / bhikṣuṃ kho punar uddiśya anyatareṣāṃ dvinnāṃ gṛhapatikānāṃ cīvaracetāpanāny
analyzed: bhikṣum kho punar uddiśya anyatareṣām dvinnām gṛhapatikānām cīvara cetāpanāni
translated: If, for a monk, two householders have prepared and set aside robe-cloth funds, thinking,

original: abhisaṃskṛtāni bhavanti abhisaṃcetayitāni imehi vayaṃ cīvaracetāpanehi civaraṃ
analyzed: abhisaṃskṛtāni bhavanti abhisaṃcetayitāni imehi vayam cīvara cetāpanehi civaram
translated: ‘With these robe-cloth funds we will buy robe-cloth

original: cetāpayitvā itthanāmaṃ bhikṣuṃ cīvareṇācchadayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: cetāpayitvā itthanāmam bhikṣum cīvareṇa ācchadayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: and give it to monk so-and-so,’

original: tatra ca bhikṣuḥ pūrvaṃ apravārito upasaṃkramitvā vikalpam āpadyeya sādhu kho puna
analyzed: tatra ca bhikṣuḥ pūrvam a pravāritaḥ upasaṃkramitvā vikalpam āpadyeya sādhu kho punar
translated: and if that monk, before being invited, approaches them and makes a suggestion, saying, ‘It would be good🔽if you, sirs, with these robe-cloth funds would buy robe-cloth

original: yūyam āyuṣmanto imehi cīvaracetāpanehi cīvaraṃ cetāpayitvā itthaṃnāmaṃ bhikṣuṃ cīvareṇācchādetha /
analyzed: yūyam āyuṣmantaḥ imehi cīvara cetāpanehi cīvaram cetāpayitvā itthaṃnāmam bhikṣum cīvareṇa ācchādetha
translated: and give it to monk so-and-so,

original: evaṃrūpeṇa vā evaṃrūpeṇa vā ubhau pi sahitau ekena kalyāṇakāmatām upādāya /
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa vā evaṃrūpeṇa vā ubhau sahitau ekena kalyāṇa kāmatām upādāya
translated: or if you would buy robe-cloth like this or like that,’ then, if he does this for the sake of getting a better robe,

original: abhiniṣpanne cīvare nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: abhiniṣpanne cīvare nissargika pācattikam
translated: when the robe is finished, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / bhikṣuṃ kho punar uddiśya anyatareṣāṃ dvinnāṃ gṛhapatikasya gṛhapatinīye ca pratyekacīvaracetāpanāni abhisaṃskṛtāni bhavanti /
analyzed: bhikṣum kho punar uddiśya anyatareṣām dvinnām gṛhapatikasya gṛhapatinīye ca pratyeka cīvara cetāpanāni abhisaṃskṛtāni bhavanti
translated: If, for a monk, two householders—a householder and his wife—have prepared and set aside separate robe-cloth funds, thinking,

original: abhisaṃcetayitāni imehi vayaṃ pratyekacīvaracetāpanehi pratyekaṃ pratyekaṃ cīvaraṃ cetāpayitvā itthaṃnāmaṃ bhikṣuṃ pratyekaṃ pratyekaṃ cīvareṇācchadayiṣyāmaḥ
analyzed: abhisaṃcetayitāni ū imehi vayam pratyeka cīvara cetāpanehi pratyekam pratyekam cīvaram cetāpayitvā itthaṃnāmam bhikṣum pratyekam pratyekam cīvareṇa ācchadayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: ‘We will make a robe for each of these monks with these robe-cloth funds that we have collected.’

original: tatra ca bhikṣuḥ pūrvaṃ apravārito upasaṃkramitvā vikalpam āpadyeya sādhu kho punas tvam āyuṣman /🔽tvaṃ ca bhagini /🔽imehi pratyekacīvaracetāpanehi pratyekaṃ cīvaraṃ cetāpayitvā itthaṃnāmaṃ bhikṣuṃ
analyzed: tatra ca bhikṣuḥ pūrvam a pravāritaḥ upasaṃkramitvā vikalpam āpadyeya sādhu kho punar tvam āyuṣman  tvam ca bhagini  imehi pratyeka cīvara cetāpanehi pratyekam cīvaram cetāpayitvā itthaṃnāmam bhikṣum
translated: Then a monk, without first being invited, should approach and make a suggestion, saying, ‘It would be good, Venerables,🔽if you would make a robe for this monk

original: pratyekaṃ cīvareṇācchādetha evaṃrūpeṇa vā evaṃrūpeṇa vā ubhau pi sahitau ekena kalyāṇakāmatām upādāya /
analyzed: pratyekam cīvareṇa ācchādetha evaṃrūpeṇa vā evaṃrūpeṇa vā ubhau sahitau ekena kalyāṇa kāmatām upādāya
translated: with these robe-cloth funds that you have collected, or if you would give the robe-cloth to this monk, so that he can make a robe. Both of you have the same wholesome intention.’

original: abhiniṣpanne cīvare nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: abhiniṣpanne cīvare nissargika pācattikam
translated: When the robe is finished, it is to be relinquished and confessed by the one who made it.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / bhikṣuṃ kho punar uddiśya anyataro rājā vā rājabhogyo vā dūtena cīvaracetāpanāni preṣeya /
analyzed: bhikṣum kho punar uddiśya anyataraḥ rājā vā rāja bhogyaḥ vā dūtena cīvara cetāpanāni preṣeya
translated: If a king or a royal minister sends robe-cloth funds by messenger to a monk, saying,

original: so bhikṣus tenopasaṃkramitvā taṃ bhikṣum evaṃ vadeya imāni khalv āryam uddiśya itthaṃnāmena rājñā ca rājabhogyena vā dūtena cīvaracetāpanāni
analyzed: saḥ bhikṣuḥ tena upasaṃkramitvā tam bhikṣum evam vadeya imāni khalu āryam uddiśya itthaṃnāmena rājñā ca rāja bhogyena vā dūtena cīvara cetāpanāni
translated: That monk, having approached him, should say this to that monk: ‘These, noble sir, are the cloth-materials for robes sent by the king of such and such a name, or by one who enjoys the king’s wealth, or by a messenger,

original: tāni āryo pratigṛhṇātu /
analyzed: tāni āryo pratigṛhṇātu
translated: for the noble sir. May the noble sir accept them.’

original: tena bhikṣuṇā so dūto evam asya vacanīyo na kho punar āyuṣman kṣamate bhikṣusya cīvaracetāpanāni pratigṛhṇituṃ /
analyzed: tena bhikṣuṇā saḥ dūtaḥ evam asya vacanīyaḥ na kho punar āyuṣman kṣamate bhikṣusya cīvara cetāpanāni pratigṛhṇitum
translated: When that is said, that monk should say this to that messenger: ‘It is not allowable, venerable sir, for a monk to accept cloth-materials for robes.

original: cīvaraṃ tu vayaṃ pratigṛhṇāmaḥ kālena samayena kalpikaṃ dīyamānaṃ /🔽evam ukte so dūto taṃ bhikṣum evaṃ vadeya santi punar ārya kecid bhikṣūṇāṃ vaiyāpṛtyakarāti /
analyzed: cīvaram tu vayam pratigṛhṇāmaḥ kālena samayena kalpikam dīyamānam  evam ukte saḥ dūtaḥ tam bhikṣum evam vadeya santi punar ārya kecid bhikṣūṇām
translated: But we accept a robe, if it is given at the right time, at the right time, if it is suitable.’🔽When that is said, that messenger should say this to that monk: ‘Are there, noble sir, any monks who are in charge of business?’

original: ākāṃkṣamāṇena bhikṣuṇā santā vaiyāpṛtyakarā vyapadiśitavyāḥ ārāmikā vā /
analyzed: ākāṃkṣamāṇena bhikṣuṇā santāḥ vaiyāpṛtya karāḥ vyapadiśitavyāḥ ārāmikāḥ vā
translated: If the monk wishes, he should point out those who are in charge of business, saying: ‘There are, venerable sir, monks who are in charge of business.

original: ete āyuṣman bhikṣūṇāṃ vaiyāpṛtyakarā ye bhikṣūṇāṃ vaiyāpṛtyaṃ karonti /
analyzed: ete āyuṣman bhikṣūṇām vaiyāpṛtya karāḥ ye bhikṣūṇām vaiyāpṛtyam karonti
translated: These, venerable sir, are monks who are in charge of business, who do business for the monks.’

original: evam ukte so dūto yena vaiyāpṛtyakarās tenopasaṃkramitvā tān vaiyāpṛtyakarān evaṃ
analyzed: evam ukte saḥ dūtaḥ yena vaiyāpṛtya karāḥ tena upasaṃkramitvā tān vaiyāpṛtya karān evam
translated: When that is said, that messenger, having approached those who are in charge of business, should say this to those who are in charge of business:

original: vadeya sādhu kho puna yūyam āyuṣmanto vaiyāpṛtyakarā imehi cīvaracetāpanehi cīvaraṃ🔽cetāpayitvā itthaṃnāma bhikṣuṃ cīvareṇācchādetha kālena samayena kalpikenānavadyena /
analyzed: vadeya sādhu khalu puna yūyam āyuṣmantaḥ vaiyāpṛtya karāḥ imehi cīvara cetāpanehi cīvaram  cetāpayitvā itthaṃnāma bhikṣum cīvareṇa ācchādetha kālena samayena kalpikena anavadyena
translated: You should say, 'It is good, venerable friends, that you, who are the ones who do the work, should make a robe with these robe-cloths🔽and clothe the monk named so-and-so with a robe at the right time, in a proper way, with what is allowable and without reproach.'

original: so ca dūto tān vaiyāpṛtyakarān saṃjñapayitvā yena so bhikṣus tenopasaṃkramitvā na
analyzed: saḥ ca dūtaḥ tān vaiyāpṛtya karān saṃjñapayitvā yena saḥ bhikṣuḥ tena upasaṃkramitvā na
translated: And that messenger, having instructed those who do the work, should approach that monk and

original: bhikṣum eva vadeya ye khu te āryeṇa vaiyāpṛtyakarā vyapadiṣṭās te mayā saṃjñaptās🔽tān upasaṃkrameyāmi /
analyzed: bhikṣum eva vadeya ye khu te āryeṇa vaiyāpṛtya karāḥ vyapadiṣṭāḥ te mayā saṃjñaptāḥ  tān upasaṃkrameyāmi
translated: speak thus to the monk: 'Those, noble sir, who were pointed out to you by the venerable one as the ones who do the work, I have instructed

original: ācchādayiṣyanti te cīvareṇa kālena samayena kalpikenānavadyena /
analyzed: ācchādayiṣyanti te cīvareṇa kālena samayena kalpikena anavadyena
translated: and they have said, We will approach and clothe you with a robe at the right time, in a proper way, with what is allowable and without reproach.

original: ākāṃkṣamāṇena bhikṣuṇā cīvarārthikena yena te vaiyāpṛtyakarās tenopasaṃkramitvā🔽te vaiyāpṛtyakarāḥ sakṛt dvikkhutto trikkhutto codayitavyā vijñāpayitavyāḥ artho
analyzed: ākāṃkṣamāṇena bhikṣuṇā cīvara arthikena yena te vaiyāpṛtya karāḥ tena upasaṃkramitvā  te vaiyāpṛtya karāḥ sakṛt dvikkhutto trikkhutto codayitavyāḥ vijñāpayitavyāḥ artho
translated: If the monk desires a robe, he should approach those who do the work

original: āyuṣmanto bhikṣusya cīvareṇeti /
analyzed: āyuṣmantaḥ bhikṣusya cīvareṇa iti
translated: and those who do the work should be reminded once, twice, or three times, 'Venerable friends, there is a need for a robe for the monk.'

original: sakṛt dvikkhutto trikkhutto codayanto vijñāpayanto taṃ cīvaram abhiniṣpādeya ity etat kuśalaṃ /
analyzed: sakṛt dvi kkhuttaḥ tri kkhuttaḥ codayantaḥ vijñāpayantaḥ tam cīvaram abhiniṣpādeya iti etat kuśalam
translated: If he makes that robe within two or three reminders and requests, it is good.

original: no ced abhiniṣpādeya catukkhutto pañcakhutto ṣaṭkhuttoparamaṃ tena bhikṣuṇā tūṣṇībhūtena uddeśe sthātavyaṃ /
analyzed: no ced abhiniṣpādeya catukkhutto pañcakhutto ṣaṣ khutta uparamam tena bhikṣuṇā tūṣṇībhūtena uddeśe sthātavyam
translated: If he does not make it, he should remain silent and still for four, five, or six reminders.

original: catukkhutto pañcakkhutto ṣaṭkkhuttoparamaṃ tūṣṇībhūto uddeśe tiṣṭhanto taṃ cīvaram abhiniṣpādeya /
analyzed: catur khuttaḥ pañca khuttaḥ ṣaṣ khutta uparamam tūṣṇībhūtaḥ uddeśe tiṣṭhantaḥ tam cīvaram abhiniṣpādeya
translated: If he makes that robe while remaining silent and still for four, five, or six reminders,

original: ity etat kuśalaṃ /
analyzed: iti etat kuśalam
translated: it is good.

original: no ced abhiniṣpādeya tad uttapanto vā vyāyamanto vā taṃ cīvaram abhiniṣpādeya /
analyzed: na u ced abhiniṣpādeya tat uttapantaḥ vā vyāyamantaḥ vā tam cīvaram abhiniṣpādeya
translated: If he does not make it, he should make an effort and make that robe.

original: abhiniṣpanne cīvare nissargikapācattikaṃ /🔽no ced abhiniṣpādeya yena se tāni rājñā vā rājabhogyena vā dūtena cīvaracetāpanāni preṣitāni tatra tena bhikṣuṇā svayaṃ vā gantavyaṃ /
analyzed: abhiniṣpanne cīvare nissargika pācattikam  no ced yena se tāni rājñā vā rājabhogyena vā dūtena cīvara cetāpanāni preṣitāni tatra tena bhikṣuṇā svayam vā gantavyam
translated: When the robe is finished, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: dūto vā pratirūpo preṣayitavyo /
analyzed: dūtaḥ vā pratirūpaḥ preṣayitavyaḥ
translated: If he does not make it, he should either go himself to the king or to the one who is enjoying the benefits of the kingdom, or he should send a suitable messenger,🔽saying,

original: yāni khu āyuṣmantehi itthaṃnāmaṃ bhikṣum uddiśya dūtena cīvaracetāpanāni preṣitāni na khu tāni tasya bhikṣusya kiñcid arthaṃ spharanti /
analyzed: yāni khu itthaṃnāmam bhikṣum uddiśya dūtena cīvara cetāpanāni preṣitāni na khu tāni tasya bhikṣusya kiñcid artham spharanti
translated: “If, Venerables, you have sent cloth for a robe through a messenger to a monk named so-and-so, it does not benefit that monk at all.

original: pratyanveṣatha /
analyzed: pratyanveṣatha
translated: You should look for it.

original: na svakaṃ dharmo /
analyzed: na svakam
translated: It is not your own property.

original: vo vipraṇaśiṣyatīti iyam atra sāmīcī /
analyzed: vaḥ vipraṇaśiṣyati iti iyam atra sāmīcī
translated: It will be lost.” This is the proper conduct in this case.

original: uddānaṃ //
analyzed: uddānam
translated: The summary:

original: daśāhaṃ vipravāso
analyzed: daśa aham vipravāsaḥ
translated: Ten days, living apart,

original: akāle ca
analyzed: akāle ca
translated: And out of season,

original: pratigraho
analyzed: pratigrahaḥ
translated: Receiving,

original: dhovanā
analyzed: dhovanā
translated: Washing,

original: yācanā caṃva /
analyzed: yācanā caṃva
translated: And asking for.

original: sāntarottaraṃ
analyzed: sa antara uttaram
translated: With an inner lining, and the next,

original: dve ca vikalpena rājā ca //
analyzed: dve ca vikalpena rājā ca
translated: And two, optionally, and a king.

original: prathamo vargaḥ //
analyzed: prathamaḥ vargaḥ
translated: The first varga.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yo puna bhikṣuḥ śuddhakālakānām eḍakalomānāṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeya nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ puna bhikṣuḥ śuddha kālakānām eḍaka lomānām navam santhatam kārāpeya nissargika pācattikam
translated: If a monk has a new blanket made entirely of eḍaka wool, he commits a offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / navaṃ santhataṃ bhikṣuṇā kārāpayamāṇena śuddhakālakānām eḍakalomānāṃ dve bhāgā ādayitavyās tṛtīyo odātikānāṃ caturtho gocarikāṇāṃ
analyzed: navam santhatam bhikṣuṇā kārāpayamāṇena śuddha kālakānām eḍaka lomānām dve bhāgāḥ ādayitavyāḥ tṛtīyaḥ odātikānām caturthaḥ gocarikāṇām
translated: If a monk is having a new blanket made, he must include two parts of new wool: a third part of white wool, and a fourth part of wool from previous blankets.

original: taduttarim ādiyeya nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: tad uttarim ādiyeya nissargika pācattikam
translated: If he includes more than that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yo puna bhikṣuḥ kauśeyamiśrāṇām eḍakalomānāṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeya nissargikapācattikaṃ /🔽PrMoSūMāLNP / / navaṃ santhataṃ bhikṣuṇā kārāpayamāṇena akāmaṃ ṣaḍvarṣāṇi dhārayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ puna bhikṣuḥ kauśeya miśrāṇām eḍaka lomānām navam santhatam kārāpeya nissargika pācattikam  navam santhatam bhikṣuṇā kārāpayamāṇena akāmam ṣaṣ varṣāṇi dhārayitavyam
translated: “Monks, if a monk has a new sitting mat made that is more than one-eighth part made of wool, it is to be relinquished and confessed.🔽“Monks, if a monk has a new sitting mat made, he must keep it for six years.

original: tato ca bhikṣuḥ pratyoreṇa taṃ purāṇaṃ santhataṃ visarjayitvā vā avisarjayitvā vā anyaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeya kalyāṇakāmatām upādāya /🔽anyatra namatasaṃmutīye nissargikapācattikaṃ /🔽PrMoSūMāLNP / / navaṃ santhataniṣīdanaṃ bhikṣuṇā kārāpayamāṇena tato purāṇasanthatāto samantāt sugatavitastinā bhāgo ādayitavyo navasya
analyzed: tatas ca bhikṣuḥ pratyoreṇa tam purāṇam santhatam visarjayitvā vā a visarjayitvā vā anyam navam santhatam kārāpeya kalyāṇa kāma tām upādāya  anyatra na mata saṃmutīye nissargika pācattikam  navam santhata niṣīdanam bhikṣuṇā kārāpayamāṇena samantāt sugata vitastinā bhāgaḥ ādayitavyaḥ navasya
translated: If a monk, out of desire, makes a new sitting mat before the six years have passed, whether he discards the old one or does not discard it, except if he has the approval of the Saṅgha, it is to be relinquished and confessed.🔽“Monks, if a monk has a new sitting mat made, he must incorporate into it a piece of the old one that is the size of a bird’s wing.

original: tato ca bhikṣur anādāya navasanthataṃ niṣīdanaṃ kārāpeya nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: tatas ca bhikṣuḥ an ādāya navasanthatam niṣīdanam kārāpeya nissargika pācattikam
translated: If a monk, out of desire, has a new sitting mat made without incorporating the piece of the old one, it is to be relinquished and confessed.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / bhikṣusya kho punar adhvānamārge pratipannasya utpadyeṃsu eḍakalomāni /
analyzed: bhikṣusya kho punar adhvāna mārge pratipannasya utpadyeṃsu eḍaka lomāni
translated: “Monks, if a monk is traveling on a road and he obtains wool,

original: ākāṃkṣamāṇena bhikṣuṇā pratigṛhṇitavyaṃ /
analyzed: ākāṃkṣamāṇena bhikṣuṇā pratigṛhṇitavyam
translated: If a monk who is in need accepts it,

original: pratigṛhṇitvā sāmaṃ triyojanaparamaṃ hartavyam asante anyasmin hārake taduttariṃ hāreya sante vā asante vā anyasmin hārake /
analyzed: pratigṛhṇitvā sāmam tri yojana paramam hartavyam asante anyasmin hārake tad uttarim hāreya sante vā asante vā anyasmin hārake
translated: and after accepting it, he may carry it himself for at most three yojanas if there is no other carrier, whether there is one or not. If he carries it beyond that, whether there is another carrier or not,

original: nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: nissargika pācattikam
translated: it is to be relinquished and confessed.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yo puna bhikṣur anyātikāye bhikṣuṇīye eḍakalomādi dhovāpeya vā raṃjāpeya vā vivaṭāpaye vā /
analyzed: yaḥ puna bhikṣuḥ anya atikāye bhikṣuṇīye eḍaka loma ādi vā vā vivaṭāpaye vā
translated: If a monk has a nun from another community wash, dye, or beat wool,

original: nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: nissargika pācattikam
translated: it is to be relinquished and confessed.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yo puna bhikṣuḥ svahastaṃ jātarūparajatam udgṛhṇeya vā udgṛhṇāpeya vā antamasato iha nikṣipehīti vā vadeya /
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhikṣuḥ sva hastam jātarūpa rajatam udgṛhṇeya vā vā iha nikṣipehi iti vā vadeya
translated: If a monk himself takes up gold or silver, or has it taken up, or says, “Put it here,”

original: upanikṣiptaṃ vā sādiyeya nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: upanikṣiptam vā sādiyeya nissargika pācattikam
translated: or if he accepts what has been put down, it is to be relinquished and confessed.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yo puna bhikṣur anekavidhaṃ krayavikrayavyavahāraṃ samāpadyeya saṃyyathīdaṃ imaṃ kriṇa ito kriṇa ettakamettakena krīṇāhīti
analyzed: punar bhikṣuḥ anekavidham kraya vikraya vyavahāram samāpadyeya saṃyyathī idam imam kriṇe ito kriṇe ettakam ettakena krīṇāhi iti
translated: If a monk engages in various kinds of buying and selling, such as saying, “Buy this, buy from here, buy so much for so much,”

original: vā vadeya /
analyzed: vā vadeya
translated: or if he says,

original: nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: nissargika pācattikam
translated: it is to be relinquished and confessed.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yo puna bhikṣur anekavidhaṃ jātarūparajatavikṛtivyavahāraṃ samāpadyeya nissargikapācattikam //
analyzed: yaḥ puna bhikṣuḥ anekavidham jātarūpa rajata vikṛti vyavahāram samāpadyeya nissargika pācattikam
translated: Pāy.1. If a monk engages in various kinds of trade involving gold and silver, he commits a pāyantika.

original: uddānaṃ //
analyzed: uddānam
translated: The summary:

original: śuddhakālakānāṃ
analyzed: śuddha kālakānām

original: dve bhāgā 🔽kauśeyamiśra
analyzed: dve bhāgā  kauśeya miśra
translated: two parts,🔽mixed with silk,

original: ṣaḍvarṣāṇi
analyzed: ṣaṣ varṣāṇi
translated: six years,

original: niṣīdanaṃ 🔽adhvānamārgo
analyzed: niṣīdanam  adhvāna mārgaḥ

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / daśāhaparamaṃ bhikṣuṇā atirekapātraṃ dhārayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: daśa aha paramam bhikṣuṇā atireka pātram dhārayitavyam
translated: Pāy.1. A monk may keep an extra alms bowl for ten days at the most.

original: taduttariṃ dhāreya nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: tad uttarim dhāreya nissargika pācattikam
translated: If he keeps it longer than that, it is to be relinquished and a pāyantika is to be confessed.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yo puna bhikṣu ūnapañcabandhanabaddhena pātreṇa anyaṃ navaṃ pātraṃ paryeṣeya kāmātām upādāya /
analyzed: yaḥ puna ūna pañca bandhana baddhena pātreṇa anyam navam pātram paryeṣeya kāmātām upādāya
translated: Pāy.2. If a monk, out of desire, seeks another new alms bowl in exchange for an alms bowl that is not broken in less than five places,

analyzed: tena bhikṣuṇā tam pātram bhikṣu parṣāye nissaritavyam

original: yo tahi bhikṣuparṣāye pātraparyanto bhavati so tasya bhikṣusya anupradātavyo evaṃ te āyuṣman pātro dhārayitavyo yāvad bhedanaṃ /

translated: The alms bowl that is the last among the alms bowls of the community of monks should be given to that monk, and he should be told: Venerable, you should keep this alms bowl until it breaks.

original: nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: nissargika pācattikam
translated: It is to be relinquished and a pāyantika is to be confessed.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yāni kho punar imāni gilānapratiṣevaṇīyāni bhaiṣajyāni bhavanti sayyathīdaṃ sarpistailamadhuphāṇitaṃ evaṃrūpāṇi gilānena
analyzed: yāni khalu punar imāni gilāna pratiṣevaṇīyāni bhaiṣajyāni bhavanti sayyathī idam sarpiḥ taila madhu phāṇitam evaṃrūpāṇi gilānena
translated: If there are these medicines that are allowed for the sick, namely, ghee, oil, honey, and sugar, then a sick

original: bhikṣuṇā satkṛtyābhigṛhītāni /
analyzed: bhikṣuṇā satkṛtya abhigṛhītāni
translated: monk may accept them respectfully.

original: kṣamate saptāhaṃ sannidhikāraṃ paribhuñjituṃ /
analyzed: kṣamate sapta aham sannidhi kāram paribhuñjitum
translated: He may keep them for seven days and consume them.

original: santaṃ śeṣaṃ nissaritavyaṃ tad uttaritavyaṃ /🔽taduttariṃ khādeya vā bhuṃjeya vā santaṃ vā śeṣabhūtaṃ nissareya nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: santam śeṣam nissaritavyam tat uttaritavyam  tad uttarim khādeya vā bhuṃjeya vā santam vā śeṣa bhūtam nissareya nissargika pācattikam
translated: The remainder should be discarded. If he were to consume more than that,🔽then, if it is not discarded, he commits a pācattika.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yo puna bhikṣu bhikṣusya cīvaraṃ datvā yathā duṣṭo doṣāt kupito anāttamāno ācchindeya vā ācchindāpayeya vā āhara bhikṣu
analyzed: yaḥ puna bhikṣu bhikṣusya cīvaram da tvā yathā duṣṭaḥ doṣāt kupitaḥ an ātta mānaḥ ācchindeya vā ācchindāpayeya vā āhara bhikṣu
translated: If a monk, having given a robe to a monk, then, because he is angry and displeased, takes it back or has it taken back, saying,

original: na te 'haṃ demīti vā vadeya /
analyzed: na te ham demi iti vā vadeya
translated: “I do not give it to you,”

original: nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: nissargika pācattikam
translated: then, if it is not discarded, he commits a pācattika.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / māso śeṣo grīṣmāṇām iti bhikṣuṇā varṣāsāṭikācīvaraṃ paryeṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: māsaḥ śeṣaḥ grīṣmāṇām iti bhikṣuṇā varṣā sāṭikā cīvaram paryeṣitavyam
translated: “Monks, when there is one month left of the hot season, a monk should look for a rainy season robe.

original: ardhamāso avaśiṣṭo ti kṛtvā snapitavyam /
analyzed: ardha māsaḥ avaśiṣṭaḥ ti kṛtvā snapitavyam
translated: When there is a half-month left, he should wash it.”

original: tato ca bhikṣuḥ pratyoreṇa varṣāsāṭikācīvaraṃ paryeṣeya /
analyzed: tatas ca bhikṣuḥ pratyoreṇa varṣāsāṭikā cīvaram paryeṣeya
translated: And a monk should look for a rainy season garment in the last month of the rainy season.

original: kṛtvā vā snāpeya /
analyzed: kṛtvā vā snāpeya
translated: Or, having made it, he should have it washed.

original: nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: nissargika pācattikam
translated: There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / yo puna bhikṣuḥ svayaṃyācikāya sūtraṃ tantuvāyena cīvaraṃ vunāpeya nissargikapācattikaṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ puna bhikṣuḥ svayaṃyācikāya sūtram tantuvāyena cīvaram nissargika pācattikam
translated: If a monk himself asks for thread and has a weaver weave robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: PrMoSūMāLNP / / bhikṣuṃ kho punar uddiśya anyataro gṛhapatir vā gṛhapatiputro vā tantuvāyena cīvaraṃ vunāpeya /
analyzed: bhikṣum kho punar uddiśya anyataraḥ gṛhapatiḥ vā gṛhapati putraḥ vā tantuvāyena cīvaram
translated: If a householder or a householder’s son has robe-cloth woven by a weaver for a monk,

original: tena ca bhikṣuḥ pūrvaṃ apravārito upasaṃkramitvā vikalpam āpadyeya sādhu kho punas tvam āyuṣmann imaṃ cīvaram āyataṃ ca karohi /🔽vistṛtaṃ ca karohi /
analyzed: tena ca bhikṣuḥ pūrvam a pravāritaḥ upasaṃkramitvā vikalpam āpadyeya sādhu kho punar tvam āyuṣman imam cīvaram āyatam ca karohi  vistṛtam ca karohi
translated: and if that monk, without first being invited, approaches that weaver and makes a suggestion, saying, “It would be good if you would make this robe-cloth long and wide,🔽well-woven, well-stretched,

original: suvutaṃ ca karohi /🔽sutacchitaṃ ca karohi /
analyzed: suvutam ca karohi  suta śitam ca karohi
translated: well-scraped,

original: suvilikhitaṃ ca karohi /🔽apy eva nāma vayaṃ pi tava kiñcid eva mātrām upasaṃharema /
analyzed: su vilikhitam ca karohi  api eva nāma vayam tava kiñcid eva mātrām upasaṃharema
translated: and well-combed,🔽so that it will last long and will be useful to me.

original: māṣakaṃ vā māṣakārhaṃ vā piṇḍapātaṃ vā piṇḍapātārhaṃ vā /
analyzed: māṣakam vā māṣaka arham vā piṇḍapātam vā piṇḍapāta arham vā
translated: I will give you a little something, a penny or the equivalent of a penny or a meal or the equivalent of a meal.”

original: tatra ca so bhikṣur evaṃ vaditvā na kiñcid eva mātrām upasaṃhareya māṣakaṃ vā māṣakārhaṃ vā piṇḍapātaṃ vā piṇḍapātārhaṃ vā /
analyzed: tatra ca saḥ bhikṣuḥ evam vaditvā na kiñcid eva mātrām upasaṃhareya māṣakam vā māṣaka arham vā piṇḍapātam vā piṇḍapāta arham vā
translated: And if that monk, after saying that, does not collect even a little, a bean, or the value of a bean, of almsfood or of a meal,

original: abhiniṣpanne cīvare nissargikapācattikaṃ /
